attributes.action: Stop the reassessment and resultant refusal of blue badges to disabled people
attributes.background:
A GOVERNMENT SHOULD BE JUDGED UPON HOW IT TREATS ITS LEAST FORTUNATE CITIZENS 
We are in a period of time where disabled people all across the country are being re-assessed for their needs, including their access to a blue badge. Please put a stop to the 1000s of disabled people losing them unjust.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is this reassessment traumatic enough for disabled people, with the potential consequence of losing their ability to confidently leave the house, assessors are in a position where they have to justify their performance through means of denying access to a certain number of people, thus looking to deny future access to a blue badge wherever they see fit. Recently, a family member who cannot walk 50 feet was told her blue badge is being revoked, due to 'evidence' that they can walk fine.

attributes.action: Allow voters to choose to rerun an election if a plurality wish it.
attributes.background: It's clear from the turnout at elections that voters are disenchanted with politics.  Many claim they dislike all candidates. All ballot papers should have an option for None of the above (NOTA). If NOTA gets more votes than any candidate, that area's election should be rerun with new candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Voter turnout in the UK has been on a long-term downward trend.  Before 2000, national elections typically attracted over 70% turnout (see http://www.ukpolitical.info/Turnout45.htm) and 80% in the early 1950s.  Since 2000, general election turnout has been below 70%.  In addition, the ability to reject a slate of candidates would address or ease many of the issues identified in the Parliamentary report here: http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmpolcon/232/23205.htm

attributes.action: Stop schools charging a fee to allow children to eat packed lunches.
attributes.background: Some state schools are charging parents up to £1.80 per child daily to eat a packed lunch on school premises. This is as much as the cost of a school meal.  Parents are paying twice to feed their children. The cost is disproportionate to the effort expended by the school to supervise lunchtimes.
attributes.additional_details:
This was uncovered by the teaching union NASUWT and reported in the press on 28th March 2016. 

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationnews/12206157/State-schools-charge-parents-to-let-children-eat-their-own-packed-lunches.html

attributes.action: force absent parents to see their children
attributes.background: absent parents put their needs first before their children,force the absent parent to see their children after all children are a lifetime commitment for both parents.children need a relationship with mum and dad through out their childhood.

attributes.action: Require Royal Mint to 'buy back' Legal Tender coinage it has issued
attributes.background: Apparently the Royal Mint has recently instructed banks not to buy back commemorative coinage such as the 2015 Buckingham Palace £100 silver coin that it issued as Legal Tender thus forcing holders of said coins to the open market
attributes.additional_details: Legal Tender - the majority of people take the phrase 'Legal Tender'  to mean that when this is applied to coinage it will be acceptable at a Bank

attributes.action: Reopen the maternity ward in Crawley Hospital
attributes.background: East surrey hospital and worthing hospital is a long way to go for ladies in labour in the Crawley/Horsham area.

attributes.action: Form an elite squadron of special forces within the G8 to execute all IS members
attributes.background: With the recent atrocities in France and Belgium the world needs to eradicate IS. Action needs to be done to stop these murderers. I propose the G8 countries establish an elite special forces to execute all known IS members on the recent list of 2000+ members from the intelligence found last month.
attributes.additional_details: Members of IS need to be wiped out. They should lose their human rights when they sign up. Too many innocent people from all over the world are losing their lives and bringing fear to millions because of idiotic beliefs which have no right in this world. The only way to deal with these brain washed murderers is to eradicate them.

attributes.action: Scrap the DVLA restriction to assign any age number plate to any age car
attributes.background:
This means that people can apply a personalised registration plate on any age car regardless of the age of plate 
Making it easier for DVLA to sell number plates and making them more valuable as they are more applicable.
attributes.additional_details:
Scrap the dated restriction preventing the application of newer style number plates to old cars 
Information on a cars actual year of release is widely available in the modern times apps HPI checks etc and this would become buyer responsibility similar to checking if a car is stolen or written off when buying. 
Making it harder to get caught out e.g 2006 plate on a 2004 car would HPI check as 2004 car.
This would mean less paperwork for DVLA and more revenue from personalised registrations

attributes.action: Raise the minium wage to £10ph a realistic living standard to not get into debt
attributes.background: The basic minimum wage is a unreasonable income to live off of especially having the responsibility of a child/ children. It is a big struggle for many working class parents/ people to make do in the society we live in to actually live off of the basic wage provided. Many people have got into debt.
attributes.additional_details: My own personal experience of getting into debt due to having to change jobs because of unsuitability, not earning enough income and then having to rely back on benefits to support myself and family showed me that wages need to be reasonable to actually live on. I have been unable to save for many years which I want to do and have been struggling to provide for my family/ myself due to the lack of suitable available work. I believe people with a stable income and career benefit our economy.

attributes.action: Crimes of Paedophilia, to carry a higher statutory sentence except murder.
attributes.background: British Law gives out larger sentences for robbery and Violence than it dose for paedophilia and possession of child pornography.

attributes.action: Delay the referendum on EU in/out until such time as the public can be educated
attributes.background: Leaving,  or remaining within, the EU is a huge decision with far reaching implications. As yet, a satisfactory, objective method of educating the decisions makers (the public) on the facts has yet to be discovered.  More time is needed to lay out the case, so the public can decide, based on facts.
attributes.additional_details:
Popular media channels are awash with the public pleading with so called subject matter experts to present objective facts to add credibility to the either the 'in' or 'out' campaigns. 

We propose that the referendum be delayed until such time that both cases can be presented fairly and properly to the public.

attributes.action: Ban telemarketing companies from using fake mobile or fake local phone numbers
attributes.background: I am sick of answering the phone to any number that starts with 01977 ( my local village)  only to find that it is a national call centre trying to sell me ppi reclaim or accident claim recovery. I only expect call from my local area if there is an issue its the same with fake mobile numbers
attributes.additional_details: I screen calls from 0845, 0800, 0345 etc because it has got to the point where I get 20 calls a day trying to sell me ppi or other insurance reclaim. The companies posing as being local to you or calling from a mobile know that they would normally be screened. Theses fake diallers should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Exemption from Immigration Health Surcharge for Marriage visa extension (FLR-M)
attributes.background: Exemption from Immigration Health Surcharge for Marriage visa extension (FLR-M) applications made within the UK from those who are earning more than £35K p.a., who never claimed any kind of benefits, who happen to also have private medical insurance cover for the whole family & hardly use NHS
attributes.additional_details: People earning more than £50K per annum contribute almost £15K per annum in taxes and national insurance. Since 2012, people on spouse visa like me have contributed more than £50K in taxes and national insurance, plus i cannot and have never claimed any benefits, plus i have a private health insurance for my family via my employer which we use the most for any kind of health problem, plus my wife and i have never really used NHS in last 3 years.

attributes.action: Abolish SEN statements on diagnosis of ASD. Those without one, are being failed.
attributes.background: My stepson, like many other children, has Asperger's. But, because he is intelligent and appears to cope with school, he can't get an educational statement of needs (SEN), resulting in him failing at school. Those without a SEN are being failed. I want to bring change to give him what he needs.
attributes.additional_details: Severe stress, anxiety and lack of support, from any part of the system, has left him facing his GCSE year with 43% attendance, inability to do moc's or exams and grades dropped from A's & C,s to U. We've had to resort to a Child Psychologist, consultant and our MP, Theresa May, to get the desperately required action to manage the associated issues. He's been failed by 'the system' and facing a bleak future without the needed help. Abolishing SEN will change his life and thousands like him.

attributes.action: Require local traffic planners to install uncontrolled roundabouts at junctions.
attributes.background: Traffic lights have been installed at number of recent new road schemes which continually disrupt the smooth flow of traffic in spite of the overwhelming evidence of the numerous existing junctions with uncontrolled roundabouts which keep traffic flowing smoothly.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the junctions which should have been controlled by roundabouts without lights but which suffer continual disruption from irrational traffic lights in spite of the evidence of numerous roundabouts nearby in Wokingham are at:
Cutbush Lane and Brookers Hill on the A327
Winners Farm, Station Link Road and William Heelas Way on the A329

attributes.action: Stop car insurance companies from discrimination against sex, age and occupation
attributes.background: Car insurance companies seem exempt from discrimination laws (Equality Act 2010) and discriminate against sex, age and occupation. They are also guilty of assuming an individual is a "bad driver" in contradiction to the statement "innocent until proven guilty," (The Human Rights Act 1998)

attributes.action: Close loopholes for multinationals before adding Licence Fees for BBC iPlayer
attributes.background: The culture secretary has today announced that he would bring forward legislation "as soon as possible" so that those watching catch-up TV do not get "a free ride".
attributes.additional_details:
This shows the skewed priorities of this government as the amount of money lost to Multi-national companies using unethical tax practices far exceeds the money to be made from the few people watching iPlayer without  a TV licence, and unfairly penalises those who have no wish to watch TV but need a computer for other purposes. 

http://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/jun/24/amazons-uk-business-paid-119m-tax-last-year

http://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/dec/15/starbucks-pays-uk-corporation-tax-8-million-pounds

http://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/mar/03/barclays-luxembourg-profits-tax-report

http://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/jul/09/budget-means-hsbc-and-standard-chartered-banks-will-pay-1bn-less-in-tax

attributes.action: Stop any added increase to the pensionable age of retirement
attributes.background: All people are entitled to some degree of dignity in old age. To raise the retirement age would be detrimental  to people's health and quality of life. People work their entire lives, the last years should be spent enjoying what they have worked so hard to achieve. This is immoral and unworkable.

attributes.action: Compulsory microchip scanning for dogs
attributes.background: In 2014, statistics show 70,000 missing pets in the UK. Many of these were dogs, and a large percentage are still missing. In April 2016 it will be compulsory to chip dogs. This will only work if checks are made.  We are looking for all vets and wardens to scan dogs, plus random checks on homes.
attributes.additional_details: A large percentage  of missing dogs are micro-chipped, but this is useless unless someone scans the dogs. Many of the dogs have been taken in or sold to unsuspecting people, some are in puppy farms, others used for dog fighting. There are so many lost pet sites now online, but we need ONE national database that all wardens have to use, and COMPULSORY scanning by all vets and wardens. Also a system of random checking of homes/farms/travellers sites to scan dogs.

attributes.action: Police should be trained to enforce law correctly without using racial profiling
attributes.background: Racial profiling affects every ethnic minority who is stopped and searched by police. But according to the statistics provided by the Ministry of Justice, some police do seem to be using racial profiling to abuse the law.
attributes.additional_details: Asian people are over five times more likely to be stopped and searched than white people. Black people are seven times more likely to be stopped and searched than white people.

attributes.action: Allow parents with a court order to be helped by local authorities with housing
attributes.background: Local authorities will only deem the person who receives child benefit to be entitled to any help with housing even when there is a court order in place stating children are to live with the other parent for half the week which is unfair and leaves so many parents in financial difficulty

attributes.action: Up the minimum wage from £6.70 to £7.50 for all workers above the age of 21.
attributes.background: Workers above the age of 21 should be entitled to the same wage as workers who are 25 years and older. People within the 21-24 age bracket need to survive just as much as 25+ year old workers who are entitled for more. And for what reason gives them a higher entitlement as we are all equals?
attributes.additional_details: I feel it's not fair and should be taken into account for debate in the house of commons. This is discriminating towards people between the age bracket of 21-24 and I don't believe this is fair on people who are bullied into employment, having to take on any job they can possibly find at minimum wage. I don't see a problem with having to find a job to get by in life, but why does the government discriminate against people like us who struggle as it stands to survive on such a small income?

attributes.action: Use reading prison for the homeless and ex service men and women!
attributes.background: I saw a post on how reading prison is empty yet still being heated 24/7 while there are homeless people out there freezing without a roof over there heads! Surely this building can be better used!!

attributes.action: Abolish the ELQ policy and give mature students a second chance.
attributes.background: The Equivalent or Lower Qualification policy prohibits second time students from getting a student loan, limiting those who want to fulfil their potential. It was supposed to save money to fund first time students. There is no evidence of this.
attributes.additional_details: I attended university in 1997 and gained a BA in Illustration. My career as a graphic designer never worked out, I had kids and worked for little money at home.  Now nearly 40 I wish to pursue a career in mental health care, starting with a BSc in Psychology. The Equivalent or Lower Qualification policy prohibits me from getting a student loan. Why should people have to decide on their career aged 18! I want to work and pay taxes but I'm unable.

attributes.action: Ensure the free 15 hours of childcare covers half terms and school holidays
attributes.background:
The free 15hrs of childcare does NOT cover half terms or school holidays.

As a working parent I find it difficult to find additional childcare during this time as financially I can't afford it and unfortunately I don't work in a school and receive the same holiday times.

attributes.action: Scotland to be responsible for its own road tax revenue and spending
attributes.background:
Scotland should be in charge of road tax generated in Scotland and how the revenue is spent .
Also in charge of their own banding of all vehicles registered in Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: Hello evryone I not happy with the state of roads in Scotland and the cost of road tax so I'm trying to get support for my petition.

attributes.action: To prevent MPs having anonymity if arrested.
attributes.background:
To prevent MPs having anonymity if arrested.
This was raised in the Houses of Parliament to be discussed Wednesday 10/02/2016, and may be waved through!,
They want their names concealed if I they carry out a criminal act, raised under the European Convention of Human Rights
attributes.additional_details: We vote people into government to represent us on the understanding they are honest citizens and will strive to ensure that governments are fair, and to raise on our behalf matters of public and private concern.they should enter into this office with no thought of creating anonymity being upstanding citizens.

attributes.action: Shops to be required by law to provide unisex fitting rooms.
attributes.background: Some trans/fluid/queer people don't feel comfortable going into fitting rooms that resemble their biological sex. It can cause anxiety and distress for the costumer.

attributes.action: Make bicycles have a yearly safety check - CASK, compulsory annual safety check.
attributes.background: As a bike shop owner I see bicycles that are in a shocking state! All motor vehicles have annual checks which are compulsory, bicycles are no different. Cycling is on the up and we feel that a cyclist should also be made to have a Compulsory Annual Safety Check (CASK). Cyclists use these roads too.
attributes.additional_details: Cyclists are using their bikes on a public highway too, so should also be made to have this check. You can't drive a car with defective brakes and tyres ie brake pads worn down to the metal and tyres that are cracked and perished. Cracked frames, bent forks, worn out wheels (braking surface), drive parts worn out which will cause slipping and injury to the rider plus other road users as well. Cyclists quite often blame motorists, but if their bike was better maintained incident could be avoided.

attributes.action: Block Kim Jong UN from entry to the UK
attributes.background: Kim Jong Un shoots innocent people and is like a terrorist

attributes.action: Legislate so all businesses to pay tax in the UK.
attributes.background: HM Treasury to change law so that companies pay tax where their customer base is i.e. at the point of contact for their goods or service.
attributes.additional_details: Large multi nationals  not paying their fair share of taxes but want the benefit of living in or doing business in the UK.

attributes.action: Build unseen sluices in the hillsides around floodzones directing water to dams.
attributes.background: My mother lost her ground floor home in a previous flood in Carlisle.
attributes.additional_details: The majority of water that broke the riverbanks came from the hillsides around the city. This rough diagram shows how that rainwater could be channeled in gulley-sluices to river dams upstream. Locals are talking about eyesore like sluices but by using the natural shape of the hill large concrete sluices cut inward at an angle could ferry the water down to dams further upstream. Largely unseen until close up they'd preserve the natural aesthetic too. http://s30.postimg.org/z4s8jt9kx/img001.jpg

attributes.action: Mandatory community service for people on jobseeker's allowance after six months
attributes.background: If a person has been claiming Jobseeker's Allowance for more than six months, they should participate in community service for 21 hours a week (half the average working week in the UK). Whilst three months was originally suggested, we believe that at least six should be granted without restriction.

attributes.action: To Obligate Social Care Workers to use Digital Pen & Paper Technology
attributes.background: They are especially useful in client facing situations, where keying data directly into a laptop or tablet may disrupt the flow of the discussions. Lightweight, as familiar as pen and paper, quick and secure, information processing away from the office has never been so simple.
attributes.additional_details:
Digital pens naturally handle text, checkboxes, sketches, unstructured notes and client signatures, making them ideal for surveys, audits, maintenance and repair records, sales visits, research questionnaires and dispatch notes.
Switching to digital pen to gather and send information leaves your field staff to do what they do best – more effectively and much quicker.
The end result? Greater productivity, better results and happy customers. You can’t put a price on that.

attributes.action: Record both 'registered keeper' & 'legal owner' on V5C (vehicle 'log book').
attributes.background: In the present system, when you buy a car you can only see the registered keeper's details, so if the car is actually owned by someone else, you could have to return the car to the legal owner.  Also, if a car is given as a gift, say from a parent to a child, the parent can legally take back the car
attributes.additional_details:
My son's car was bought by his dad and gifted to him and registered in my son's name as the 'registered keeper'.  After a 'falling out', the dad re-registered the car in his own name, without my son's permission or signature.  The DVLA told me that, as the dad had paid for the car, he was the 'legal owner'.
If the 'registered keeper' & 'legal owner' were both recorded on the V5C, and both had to sign for a change of keeper/owner, we would all know where we stood & there wouldn't be this problem.

attributes.action: Set the voting age for referendums to 16
attributes.background:
Referendums cover issues with a long term effect. 

Very often a 16 year old at voting time will be 18 when the decision comes into force
attributes.additional_details:
In Scotland the voting age for many elections is already 16.

It is not logical to deprive these people of the vote for referendums.

A next step should be to make the voting age for referendums 16 throughout the UK

attributes.action: Make Friday a Half working day
attributes.background: Gives everyone a longer weekend. People will be happier and less stressed.

attributes.action: British government should pay costs for 15 year plus ex pats to be EU citizens.
attributes.background: Ex pats that still hold a British passport and have been ex pats for 15 plus years in an EU land and were not allowed to vote in the EU rederendum should have the costs of changing citizenship to that of their current EU home, covered by the British Government.
attributes.additional_details: We had no say in the referendum but we may have to leave our EU homes due to stricter EU rules that may be imposed on British ex pats. This is undemocratic. A compensatory amount of no less than €1500,00 should me made available to any 15 year plus expat who chooses to revoke their British citizenship.  A separate arrangement should also be considered for any British State pension funds that may have accrued.

attributes.action: Put all primary and senior school teachers on the Shortage Occupation List.
attributes.background: The Home Office has enacted a new settlement threshold for Tier 2 skilled workers, which includes teachers. The Home Office Impact Assessment estimates this will result in the forced departure of 36% of migrant primary school teachers and 9% of migrant senior school teachers as their visas expire.
attributes.additional_details:
The Home Office must commission the Migration Advisory Committee to study the teacher recruitment crisis. The HO will need to act on the MAC's recommendation.

Chemistry, physics and maths teachers are already on the SOL but every subject faces staff shortages. Teaching cannot afford to lose essential staff purely because they are underpaid.

42% of migrant nurses would have been forced to leave until nurses were put on the SOL.

Learn more about the impacts of the £35k threshold at stop35k.org

attributes.action: Referendum on income tax
attributes.background:
Holding a referendum has proven to be an effective and democratic way to decide the nation's future in matters of highest importance.
We therefore propose to hold a referendum to decide to abolish the income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 the tax payers have paid a weekly amount of £3.1billion in
income tax across all bands. We propose to abolish such mandatory
payment to the state, and instead to take back control of this money
and fund the NHS with an additional £3.1billion per week.
In order to comply with the rules of democracy we suggest that no less than the majority (i.e. 23,299,988 people) of eligible voters must be in favour. We can entrust the voters to make the right decision for
the Country.

attributes.action: Investigate UK areas of deep social dislocation and propose remedial measures
attributes.background: The result of the EU Referendum on 23 June revealed significant differences between different parts of the UK. Polls also revealed sharply constrasting social circumstances and motivations for the different votes. There appears to be a causative correlation between vote and social circumstances.
attributes.additional_details:
The poll conducted by Lord Ashcroft shows significant social, educational and age differences between the two sides of the EU Referendum votes: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/
The differences in the voting in different parts of the country are readily available.

attributes.action: In 2018 hold a referendum on whether negotiated EU Exit terms are acceptable.
attributes.background:
Suggested:
The UK will shortly be leaving the European Union; How should the UK continue trading with the EU? 
1. Trade on the terms of the draft Exit treaty  between the UK and EU? 
2. Trade with the EU only on World Trade Organization rules, until a better Trade Agreement with the EU is agreed?
attributes.additional_details:
This new referendum will seek to ensure that the will of the majority that voted to LEAVE is not watered down by weak UK negotiators who, to gain free trade arrangements, might give away the control of free-movement-of-labour that was voted for. 

Or secondly if the EU is dogmatic and unwilling to include UK control of movement-of-labour this vote effectively gives those who voted to REMAIN  a second referendum.

attributes.action: Make MP's like us: 93% state school; 50% women; 100% from their constituency.
attributes.background: The country is economically and politically divided. MP's are bewildered by those outside London because they are so different from them. Let's break the domination of private school educated, London based men in our politics. Bring in quotas now for our representatives so MP's look like us.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of the population are women. Women got the vote a hundred years ago and still they are under represented and under paid in every walk of life.
7% of the population are private school educated and yet they make up to 50% of MP's in government. 
Career politicians live and work in London and do not understand the people they represent. 
These three problems can be solved by the next General Election. Let's make MP's more like us and bring in quotas for a fairer, less divided, United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Don't scrap the right to buy on uk council homes
attributes.background:
Don't  scrap  the right to buy scheme for uk council homes 


The right to buy  is the only way most people will ever get on the housing ladder

attributes.action: Ensure the police can protect minority groups while the Brexit talks take place
attributes.background: In light of the recent increase in racist attacks in the immediate aftermath of the Brexit vote, we call on the government to condemn these attacks in the strongest language and ensure that the police have the resources to protect all our minority populations during the Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: Ensure that all bureaucrats involved in EU exit talks are elected non-experts
attributes.background:
The British people have demonstrated their desire to free themselves from government by unelected bureaucrats and so-called experts.
The will of the people must be respected: all those involved in EU exit negotiations should have no expertise and should be elected directly to the role.
attributes.additional_details:
Much of the campaign to leave the EU focused on our lives being run by unelected bureaucrats and the 'misinformation' provided by experts. The massive 3.8% majority for leave in the referendum is a clear mandate to end the negative influence of unelected bureaucrats and experts.
Anyone involved in EU exit talks should be directly elected. Given the timeframe of the negotiations, their terms of office should be for 8 months, allowing us to assess their performance and get rid of them if need be.

attributes.action: 2nd referendum for 16-50 year olds
attributes.background: Almost two thirds of over 60s voted in favour of Brexit and those under 49 voted to remain (according to advance polling). Three quarters of people aged 18-24 voted to remain. It is not fair that the older generation have dominated a large percentage of votes and decided the future for the young.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from Buzzfeed article: https://www.buzzfeed.com/patricksmith/young-people-are-angry-at-old-people-for-voting-leave?utm_term=.eo43KzXBMe#.eo43KzXBMe

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons in Secondary Schools optional
attributes.background: Pupils in Secondary schools are being forced to take part in swimming lessons, being told it 'isn't optional', despite most children being taught how to swim in Primary school. Adolescents should be given the choice whether they want to swim or not, as some are not comfortable doing so.
attributes.additional_details: Older children are being forced to wear swimming costumes and swim in a group with their peers, which can often cause distress, particularly to adolescents having their period who may be forced to wear tampons, or those not comfortable with wearing such clothing in front of others.

attributes.action: During referendums all politicians swear before a judge to tell the whole truth
attributes.background: the public should be able to take demonstratable factual evidence from politicians on important subjects usually called in referendums. The politicians should clearly state what are facts and what is speculation & as in a court should be asked to swear an oath which supports this.
attributes.additional_details: The 2016 EU referendum on either was clearly not based on a facts or truths. This has the potential for causing great harm.

attributes.action: We would like to propose that May 1st be officially recognised as Union Day.
attributes.background: On the 1st May 1707 Parliament officially recognised the union of Great Britain
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acts_of_Union_1707
